titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Library Special Collections (LSC) departmental decor collection Internal.001
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Kelly Besser, 2021.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 2022 March 17.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-12-16 13:01:55 -0800.

did.unittitle: Library Special Collections (LSC) departmental decor collection

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Library Special Collections (LSC) departmental decor collection contains materials which range from A.D. 79 through 2013. The collection consists of 48 framed artworks which were either purchased by the department, donated to the department, or reproduced from the department's holdings for the purpose of work space decoration. These artworks include posters, letterpress creations, photographs, paintings, a map, photogenic drawings, serigraphs, a panorama print, photographic reproductions, and a Festina Lente piece which contains a silver denarius. The majority of these artworks were purchased by Victoria Steele between 2000-2009 during her tenure as head of Special Collections while the department received the majority of its letterpress artworks in 1997 from James Davis when he retired as Rare Books Librarian from Special Collections.
